intro: Cuphea indocta, commonly known as the flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil. Cuphea indocta is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees.
